para.caption: Nagios NSCA client (Nagios Service Check Acceptor)
para.text:
Nagios is the successor of Netsaint, a host and service monitoring tool. Nagios checks services by, for example, pinging a host, testing whether a port can be connected or executing any other user-defined check.
There are basically two types of checks: Active and passive checks. Active checks are initiated by Nagios in configured intervals. Passive checks results are submitted by the monitored service itself. NSCA is a client/server protocol that allows inter-machine status result transfers via TCP/IP.
See for an example on how to use these classes.
